oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Document from Morgan County case for property taken by Confederates
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civil War case between Joseph Holloway and William Lewallen & John Lewallen in Morgan County Chancery Court. According to the complaint, the Lewallens owe Holloway "for keeping, aiding & directing Rebel forces who with armes and force to[ok] from him the said Holloway the following property in the years 1861, 1862 and 1863:" saddles, hay, corn, horses, furniture, clothes, a riflle, one beef steer, hogs, and bee stands totaling $1205.
